title: Trump’s Rift With Europe Is Clear. Europe Must Decide What to Do About It.
summary: After President Trump aired his disdain for Europe, its leaders will gather in Brussels Thursday to take stock of what comes next.

title: China Wins as Trump Cedes Leadership of the Global Economy
summary: The president used a keynote speech at the World Economic Forum in Switzerland to renounce the last vestiges of the liberal democratic order.

title: Trump Drops Tariff Threats Over Greenland After Meeting With NATO Chief
summary: President Trump’s announcement appeared to draw the United States back from the possibility of military and economic conflict with American allies over Greenland.

title: Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ Would Have Global Scope but One Man in Charge
summary: The initiative is the latest example of the president dismantling the post-World War II international system and building a new one, with himself at the center.

title: Cuban Detainee in El Paso ICE Facility Died by Homicide, Autopsy Shows
summary: The report from the county medical examiner said the detainee, Geraldo Lunas Campos, was asphyxiated and restrained by law enforcement. Federal officials described his death as a suicide.

title: Court Removes Restrictions on ICE’s Use of Pepper Spray, for Now
summary: The Eighth Circuit granted the Trump administration’s request to block, for the moment, a lower court’s injunction limiting how federal agents interact with protesters in Minnesota.

title: Former Uvalde Officer Adrian Gonzales Found Not Guilty of Endangering Children in Mass Shooting
summary: Adrian Gonzales had faced 29 charges for his actions in the 2022 shooting, in which 19 children were killed by a gunman at Robb Elementary School in Texas.

title: Widespread Winter Storm Is Forecast to Bring Heavy Snow to Central and Eastern US
summary: People across a large section of the central and eastern United States are facing predictions of heavy snow and ice starting Friday.

title: Snow Maps and More: Everything You Could Want to Know About This Winter Storm
summary: Here’s a look at the latest forecasts, and how to prepare.

title: FCC Targets Colbert and Kimmel in New Crackdown on Late-Night TV
summary: The F.C.C. said it planned to enforce long-dormant rules on appearances by political candidates on network talk shows.

title: RFK Jr., Kicking Off National Tour, Says He’s Not Running for President
summary: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. rallied supporters at the Pennsylvania State Capitol, where he promoted his new dietary guidelines.

title: Supreme Court Seems Poised to Reject Trump’s Attempt to Immediately Fire a Fed Governor
summary: During arguments, key justices appeared concerned that the president’s efforts to oust Lisa Cook could imperil the central bank’s independence.

title: Supreme Court Hearing Reveals Unease Over Threats to Fed Independence
summary: As the justices weighed the consequences of allowing President Trump to fire a Federal Reserve official, the president reprised his pressure campaign on the central bank.

title: Iran’s Protests Have Been Completely Squashed, Government Says
summary: After a crackdown that killed thousands, Iran’s prosecutor general said on Wednesday that “the sedition is over now,”  vowing to punish those responsible for the protests.

title: At Yosemite National Park, Staffing Cuts Mean Visitors Have Gone Wild
summary: After the Trump administration’s cuts, workers at the national park are spread too thin to stop people from littering, flying drones and cliff-diving.

title: Rahm Emanuel Calls for Age Limit of 75 for President, Congress and Judges
summary: The former Chicago mayor, who is trying to shape the Democratic Party’s future and might run for president, said that “across all three branches of government, 75 years — you’re out.”

title: Michelle Obama and Gretchen Whitmer Disagree on America’s Readiness for a Female President
summary: As Mrs. Obama defended her remarks from November that the country wasn’t ready for a woman as president, Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan offered a different view.

title: Michele Tafoya Announces Senate Run in Minnesota
summary: Ms. Tafoya, once a sideline reporter for N.F.L. games, has more recently turned her focus to Republican politics. She is seeking an open seat now held by a Democrat.

title: Judge Rules for Democrats in Push to Redraw N.Y.C. House District
summary: The ruling, which is expected to be appealed, allows the state to change the boundary lines of a district held by a Staten Island Republican since 2021.

title: Job Applicants Sue A.I. Recruitment Tool Company
summary: A recently filed lawsuit claims the ratings assigned by A.I. screening software are similar to those of a credit agency and should be subject to the same laws.

title: Months After Daniel Naroditsky’s Death, the Chess World Remains Divided
summary: The death of Daniel Naroditsky exposed the conflicts between the game’s traditional wing and its many online stars.

title: Hollywood’s Woke Era Is Over. Now It’s Turning the Culture War Into Camp.
summary: The industry seemed penned in by our political debates — until it started channeling them into wild caricatures and frothy drama.

title: An Unhinged President on the Magic Mountain
summary: Trump’s Davos speech could have been ghostwritten by Mario Puzo.

title: My Rohingya People Are Running Out of Time
summary: Genocide hearings in The Hague offer a ray of hope for the Rohingya, but aid cuts are worsening a humanitarian crisis in refugee camps.

title: House Panel Votes to Hold Clintons in Contempt in Epstein Inquiry
summary: The votes by the Oversight panel were bipartisan, though many Democrats said the charges were extreme given Bill and Hillary Clinton’s willingness to answer questions.

title: Heart Disease and Stroke Still Leading Causes of Death in U.S.
summary: Deaths from both causes are down, but they still eclipse all other causes, according to new statistics.

title: Parents Sue Residential Home Over Abuse of Their Autistic Son
summary: Anil and Shalini Babbar said they would not have known about the abuse their teenager was enduring at the home in upstate New York if a whistle-blower had not sent footage of an assault.

title: Austin Thompson Pleads Guilty in North Carolina Shooting That Left 5 Dead
summary: It is highly uncommon for mass shooters to plead guilty in a country where such attacks seem all too frequent. The man’s lawyers said he wanted to spare the community from further trauma.
